creator: lukrez@gmx.at
text:
The security note for the optional task "sshexec" advises to specify login name
and password on the command line:

  Invoke ant with the following command line:
    ant -Dusername=me -Dpassword=mypassword target1 target2

This command line will be visible to users on the same machine who can retrieve
a listing of currently running programs (including their command line) using "ps
-elf", for example.
made the recommendation weaker with svn revision 676616

creator: bodewig@apache.org
lukrez@gmx.at
text:
(In reply to comment #3)
> you mean use the same wording on sshexec's page that is currently used on scp's
> - or vice versa?

The former one.  The description for the Scp task contains the following security note:

> Security Note: Hard coding passwords and/or usernames in scp task can be a 
> serious security hole. Consider using variable substitution and include the 
> password on the command line. For example:
>
>     <scp todir="${username}:${password}@host:/dir" ...>
>
> Invoking ant with the following command line:
>
>     ant -Dusername=me -Dpassword=mypassword target1 target2
>
> Is slightly better, but the username/password is exposed to all users on a
> Unix system (via the ps command). The best approach is to use the <input> task > and/or retrieve the password from a (secured) .properties file.  

I think this clearly describes all options with their respective weaknesses.  I think the Sshexec task should contain a similar hint.
